answers.answer: If you went for your glucose test then yes. Your not suppose to eat sugar before the test. They will just give you the 3 hour test next.

You can opt out if you have no risk factors for gestational diabetes.  Sugar or carbs before the test will make it test high.  Go for a high protein breakfast like eggs and bacon or sausage.  If they already did the test without warning request to retest because it is definitely going to show that you have gd.
Thank you ladies. It was without warning that's why I was worried. I had a few sweets before going so I knew I would fail it.

Without warning? That's odd. They usually warn you at the appointment before and tell you the food restrictions so you can prepare for it.But when again i guess the test has improved since my last pregnancy.  Because i had to fast for 8 hours before that test. This time they just said nothing sweet before.

Yeah they left the room to fix the due date issue, and she popped back in asking if I had time to do the test. And I did so I agreed. Then today I realized that morning/afternoon I had had a pop tart, gatorade, and a fruit roll-up. And even my mom said they were supposed to warn you beforehand about the restrictions. And today I got a call saying I needed to come back for the 3 hour test. And I'm dreading it!

question: Okay so yesterday I had a regular monthly check up. And after two ultrasounds confirming that I'm now due Nov. 20th, they STILL had the wrong information in the system. So they randomly decided that I should do my sugar test since I wasn't 29 weeks, only 26. Which was fine, but I had just had a pop-tart and a lot of gatorade right before my appointment. Could that affect my test results?
title: Question about the sugar test.
